name: Frontier Airlines Airbus 321 Red-Eye Flight: Denver to Indianapolis
description:
Welcome!  This is a full flight video aboard Frontier Airlines Flight 610 with nonstop service from Denver International Airport to Indianapolis International Airport aboard an Airbus 321, Powder the Polar Bear.
After walking thirty miles through Denver following an early morning flight from Indianapolis, it was time to return home.  There was a short delay before leaving Denver, but we still arrived in Indianapolis in a fairly timely and expeditious fashion.
This video covers the empty airport terminals at DEN, the boarding process, pushback and taxi, take-off, and a few strong thunderstorms nearby on approach and landing.
 Thanks again for watching, and enjoy!
For a more in-depth tour of DEN, check out my channel and look for my five-minute-tour!
--------------------------------
Flight Information
Airline: Frontier
Flight Number: FT610
Date of Flight: Tuesday, September 27, 2016

Origin Airport: Denver International Airport (KDEN/DEN)
Destination Airport: Indianapolis International Airport (KIND/IND)

Departing Gate: A42
Scheduled Departure: 23:59 MDT
Actual Departure from Gate: 00:28 MDT
Takeoff Runway and Time: RWY 17R / 00:39 MDT
Landing Runway and Time: RWY 23R / 04:38 EDT
Scheduled Arrival: 04:21 EDT
Actual Arrival at Gate: 04:44 EDT
Arriving Gate: B15

--------------------------------
Aircraft Information
Name: Powder the Polar Bear
Type: Airbus 321-211
Registration: N711FR 
Aircraft Delivery: June 2016
Engines: 2x CFM International 56-5
Seat: 9A

--------------------------------
Video Highlights and Timeline
00:30 - Boarding
00:55 – Pushback
01:45 - Taxi
04:30 - Takeoff
06:00 - Approach
06:55 - Landing
08:50 – Deplaning

--------------------------------
Gear
Nikon D3200/18-55mm lens
LP Microphone
GO PRO Hero
